meanings.definition: To cause someone to become wildly excited or uncontrolled.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party was frenzying her with joy.
meanings.sent2: The children were frenzying with happiness at the playground.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's antics were frenzying the family into fits of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The music frenzying the crowd into a dancing frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory frenzying the fans with euphoria.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of wild excitement or uncontrolled activity.
meanings.sent1: The fans were frenzying with anticipation before the concert.
meanings.sent2: The market was frenzying with buyers during the sale.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was frenzying around the park, gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: The storm was frenzying the sea into a chaotic dance of waves.
meanings.sent5: The firework display frenzying the night sky with bursts of color.
